snippet: Trinity Industries says they did not reveal failed crash tests for a guardrail, because that particular style was never used. Plaintiffs, however, claim it is very similar to those in use.
abstract: Trinity Industries finds itself on defensive in federal whistle-blower trial as it tries to explain why five failed crash tests of its roadway guardrails were not disclosed to authorities; case is being brought under False Claims Act by competitor Joshua Harman.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: Trinity Industries says they did not reveal failed crash tests for a guardrail, because that particular style was never used. Plaintiffs, however, claim it is very similar to those in use.

headline.main: Guardrail Tests Went Unreported, Court Hears
headline.print_headline: Guardrail Tests Went Unreported, Court Hears
